greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least previously nonoccurring positive integer such that partial sum + 1 is prime.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) = {1,3} UNION {permutation of even positive numbers}.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = MIN{k>0 such that 1 + k + SUM[i=1..n-1]a(i) is prime and k <> a(i)}.
maple: N:= 200: # to get all terms before the first term > N
for n from 3 while assigned(A[n-1]) do
for k from 1 to nops(S) do
mathematica: f[s_] := Append[s, k = 1; p = 1 + Plus @@ s; While[MemberQ[s, k] || ! PrimeQ[p + k], k++ ]; k]; Nest[f, {}, 67] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Aug 30 2006
ext: Corrected and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 31 2006
